summary:
## Operating Systems: Your Computer's Traffic Cop

An operating system (OS) is like the traffic cop for your computer. It manages everything, from how your computer uses its memory and processor to how programs run.  Think of it as the middleman between your computer's hardware (like the keyboard and screen) and the software you use (like games and apps).

There are different types of operating systems, like Windows, macOS, Linux, and Android, each with its own strengths. They're used in everything from smartphones to supercomputers.
title: Operating system
